title: Tibbers goes on holiday!

embed.description: Taking some time off from being a League of Legends icon, Tibbers the demon teddybear took a few days to travel to and explore Edinburgh, and brought some pictures back to remember his trip!

body:
**Context**
My girlfriend and I took a few days to go and explore Edinburgh, and decided that we weren't the only ones who deserved a holiday!

Hope you enjoy this photo journal of Tibbers' adventures!

Also massive shout-out to the League fan we grabbed in Edinburgh Zoo who had his photo taken with Tibbers in his 2014 Championship jacket! I didn't get a chance to grab your name but if its you please make yourself known! If you've any problem having your photo included just tell me where in the zoo I found you and ask me to remove it!

replies.body:
D'awww! This is awesome! It reminds me of when my elementary school would have us do Flat Stanley. (This is way cooler.)

For those unfamiliar, [this](http://bearessentialnews.com/images/flatStanley.gif) is Flat Stanley. You'd color him in and take him on a vacation with you and take pictures with him. I don't know if people still do this. >_>

I remember that.
Mine "accidentally" died in a fire. (>_>)
Annie, is that you?! Tibbers, are you okay?!

No, I;m not Annie.

And Tibbers enjoyed it.
. . . I think.
I remember doing that. That was a really weird thing.
Right?! I never knew where to put him. I'd be like, 'here he is at the ocean, yayyyy.'
You act surprised at me burning him, but you drown him in turn!?
I remember either me or my brother putting him in a pile of watermelons at the supermarket. We did very little that summer.
My favorite pics are Tibbers's Burger King meal, and his bagpipe. In general, this entire thing is extremely awesome and adorable.

The one i'm glad to have is of another League fan. I was hoping someone would recognise Tibbers and approach us but nobody ever did. But wearing the 2014 Championship jacket was a bit of a give-away for a fellow summoner and I was hoping to get one with another player to prove Tibbers has fans.

In general, i'm just so happy I found him a Scottish costume. We went into a Build-a-bear looking for a hoody that might fit him and found a full costume that fits perfectly and made all of the days photos a bit more awesome.
The Scottish costume was really cool. Well, except for the fact that I don't like Build-A-Bear because I used to work for one of their competitors, but that's beside the point.
If build-a-bear have a competitor in the UK I've never come across it XD there's not much in the way of choice when it comes to teddybear clothing.
Eh, mine is an extremely local US store. It used to have branches in most of the USA, but now it's the only one. In a strip mall in a suburb of DC. Next to a bike store. It isn't very busy.
I really like the pictures! Who knew Tibbers was a train kind of guy.
He wanted to drive but he can't reach the pedals.
This is very cute, needs to be bumped up!
